page.title: 01ELHAM -POSITION
page.content: The main features of this area are the beautiful hills rising on the west to 150m at{Mill Hill Farm}and on the east to 160m at{Mounts Court Farm.}At the bottom of the valley flows the {River Nailbourne,}the intermittent stream, that was once much wider than it is now. The villages of{Elham,}in the north and{Lyminge}in the south, with the hamlet of{Ottinge}between form the main areas of population. There are many buildings of historical and architectural interest in the villages and surrounding area. {Elham}in particular has{26 Grade II listed buildings and many of lesser grades. The grazing of Sheep and Cattle in the valley, with arable farming on the hilltops provides the major proportion of land use.
